alert.note: Alert for Emery (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 30 at 12:21PM MDT until September 30 at 3:30PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Emery County in central Utah... * Until 330 PM MDT. * At 1221 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across Crack Canyon, Chute Canyon, and Little Wildhorse Canyon. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 0.75 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of slot canyons, normally dry washes, creeks and streams. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Crack Canyon, Chute Canyon, Little Wildhorse Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
